intro: Macrocentrum maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's macrocentrum, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided lobes that contribute to its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
